V.iii.3.1.a
.
Definition:  Infectious Diseases
Infectious diseases
are disorders caused by organisms, such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
Example
:  Malaria.
Note
:  Consider presumptive service connection (SC) for infectious diseases listed in
38 CFR 3.309(b)
based on tropical service
38 CFR 3.309(c)
based on confirmed former prisoner of war (FPOW) status, and
38 CFR 3.317(c)
based on service in the Southwest Asia theater of operations during the Gulf War or on or after September 19, 2001, in Afghanistan.
References
:  For more information on presumptive SC for
tropical diseases, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iii, 1
FPOW disabilities, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 2.D
, and
infectious diseases under
38 CFR 3.317
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.p
.
